page.title: 04LIMERIGG CROFTING 3
page.content: Mrs Kay is able to relate some very interesting stories pertaining to the area. She remembers when the village had no plumbed-in water and the women used to drag their clothes on a wooden "sledge" up the hill to the Black Loch where they would do their washing. Things have changed considerably in the village as most of the present houses were built after World War II, but Mrs Kay's croft remains very similar to what it was. She and her husband,now in their eighties,along with their handicapped son in his fifties would appear to be thriving on their lifestyle which still incorporates long hours of hard work and lots of good,country-fresh air.
